==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|べつ|はら|k2=ばら|r=yes|yomi=j}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=べつばら|別|tr1=betsu|t1=separate|腹|tr2=hara|t2=stomach, belly}}. {{rendaku2|sort=べつばら|hara|bara}}

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=j|べつばら|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|べつばら}}

# {{lb|ja|literally|sort=べつばら}} “[[separate]] [[stomach]]”: [[appetite]] or ability to continue eating after a [[meal]]: a [[hollow leg]]
#: This sense may extend to the appetite for or capacity to eat a particular type of food, such as [[sweets]].
#: {{ja-usex|甘い物は'''別腹'''だ。|^あまい もの は '''べつばら''' だ。|I've got a '''separate stomach''' ('''hollow leg''') for sweets.}}
# {{lb|ja|literally|sort=べつばら}} “[[separate]] [[belly]]”: in reference to [[sibling]]s who share the same [[father]] but have different [[mother]]s.

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|べつ|k1=べっ|ふく|k2=ぷく}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=べっぷく}} compound {{m|ltc|別腹|tr=bhyɛt biuk|lit=separate, other + belly, abdomen}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|べっぷく}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|べっぷく}}

# {{lb|ja|literally|sort=べっぷく}} “[[separate]] [[belly]]”: in reference to [[sibling]]s who share the same [[father]] but have different [[mother]]s.
